intro: Mikania liervalii, commonly known as the creeping mikania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a vine or shrub, often climbing or spreading along the ground. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Mikania liervalii is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
